title: Management Strategy Evaluation Toolkit
text: Management Strategy Evaluation toolkit (MSEtool) core package openMSE collection packages. contains core functions constructing operating models, simulating fishery dynamics, evaluating effectiveness alternative management strategies using closed-loop simulation testing. can learn openMSE packages openMSE documentation site.

title: Management Strategy Evaluation Toolkit
text: can install released version MSEtool CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("MSEtool") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Blue-Matter/MSEtool")

what: Convert ASAP 3 assessments into an operating model — ASAP2OM
title: Convert ASAP 3 assessments into an operating model — ASAP2OM
text: Reads fitted ASAP model uses MLE estimates identical reconstruction among simulations. Future recruitment sampled lognormal distribution autocorrelation. ASAP2Data imports Data object.

title: Convert ASAP 3 assessments into an operating model — ASAP2OM
code: ASAP2OM(   asap,   nsim = 48,   proyears = 50,   mcmc = FALSE,   Name = "ASAP Model",   Source = "No source provided",   nyr_par_mu = 3,   Author = "No author provided",   report = FALSE,   silent = FALSE )  ASAP2Data(asap, Name = "ASAP assessment")

title: Convert ASAP 3 assessments into an operating model — ASAP2OM
text: asap list returned ASAP, e.g., asap <- dget("asap3.rdat"). nsim number simulations operating model proyears number MSE projection years mcmc Logical, whether use mcmc samples. Currently unsupported. Name name operating model Source Reference assessment documentation e.g. url nyr_par_mu integer, number recent years estimate vulnerability future projections Author assessment report Logical, comparison biomass reconstruction produced? silent Logical, progress reporting printed console?

what: Reads bootstrap estimates from a stock assessment model into a multi-fleet operating model. — Assess2MOM
title: Reads bootstrap estimates from a stock assessment model into a multi-fleet operating model. — Assess2MOM
text: function develops multiple fleet operating model (MOM) either models unisex 2-sex stock arrays abundance, fishing mortality, biological parameters. user still needs parameterize observation implementation portions operating model.

title: Reads bootstrap estimates from a stock assessment model into a multi-fleet operating model. — Assess2MOM
code: Assess2MOM(   Name = "MOM created by Assess2MOM",   proyears = 50,   interval = 2,   CurrentYr = as.numeric(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")),   h = 0.999,   Obs = MSEtool::Imprecise_Unbiased,   Imp = MSEtool::Perfect_Imp,   naa,   faa,   waa,   Mataa,   Maa,   laa,   fecaa,   nyr_par_mu = 3,   LowerTri = 1,   recind = 0,   plusgroup = TRUE,   altinit = 0,   fixq1 = TRUE,   report = FALSE,   silent = FALSE,   ... )

title: Reads bootstrap estimates from a stock assessment model into a multi-fleet operating model. — Assess2MOM
text: Name Character string. name multi-OM. proyears Positive integer. number projection years MSE. interval Positive integer. interval management procedures update management advice multiMSE, e.g., 1 = annual updates. CurrentYr Positive integer. current year (e.g., final year fitting data) h steepness stock-recruitment curve. Either single numeric length nsim vector. Obs Either single observation model used sexes populations (class Obs), list Obs[[f]] Obs object fleet f (identical sexes). Imp Either single implementation model used sexes populations (class Imp), list Imp[[f]] Obs object fleet f (identical sexes). naa Numbers--age sex [first age age zero]. Four-dimensional numeric array [sim, ages, year, p]. [p] indexes population, [p = 1] females [p = 2] males. faa Fishing mortality rate--age sex fleet [first age age zero]. Five-dimensional numeric array [sim, ages, year, p, f] [f] indexes fishery fleet. waa Weight--age [first age age zero]. Four-dimensional numeric array [sim, ages, year, p]. Mataa Maturity (spawning fraction)--age [first age age zero]. Four-dimensional numeric array  [sim, ages, year, p]. Maa Natural mortality rate--age [first age age zero]. Four-dimensional numeric array [sim, ages, year, p]. laa Length--age [first age age zero]. Four-dimensional numeric array [sim, ages, year, p]. fecaa Fecundity age [first age age zero]. missing, default fecundity product maturity weight age. nyr_par_mu Positive integer. number recent years natural mortality, age vulnerability, weight, length maturity parameters averaged defining future projection conditions. LowerTri Integer. number recent years model estimates recruitment ignored (reliably estimated assessment) recind Positive integer. first age class fish 'recruit fishery'. default 0 - ie first position age dimension naa age zero plusgroup Logical. assessment assume oldest age class plusgroup? altinit Integer. Various assumptions set initial numbers. 0: standard, 1: plus group, 2: temporary fix MSEtool plus group initialization fixq1 Logical. q fixed (ie assume F--age array faa accurate? report Logical, TRUE, diagnostic reported showing matching OM reconstructed numbers age vs assessment. silent Whether silence messages console. ... Additional arguments (, either numeric length nsim vector): SRrel Stock-recruit relationship. (1 Beverton-Holt (default), 2 Ricker) R0 unfished recruitment phi0 unfished spawners per recruit associated R0 h. time-varying parameters, openMSE uses mean phi0 first ageM (age 50 percent maturity) years stock-recruit relationship. Assess2OM re-calculate R0 h operating model stock-recruit alpha beta parameters match values implied input. Perr recruitment standard deviation (lognormal distribution) sampling future recruitment AC autocorrelation future recruitment deviates.

code: Assess2OM(   Name = "A fishery made by VPA2OM",   proyears = 50,   interval = 2,   CurrentYr = as.numeric(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")),   h = 0.999,   Obs = MSEtool::Imprecise_Unbiased,   Imp = MSEtool::Perfect_Imp,   naa,   faa,   waa,   Mataa,   Maa,   laa,   nyr_par_mu = 3,   LowerTri = 1,   recind = 0,   plusgroup = TRUE,   altinit = 0,   fixq1 = TRUE,   report = FALSE,   silent = FALSE,   ... )  VPA2OM(   Name = "A fishery made by VPA2OM",   proyears = 50,   interval = 2,   CurrentYr = as.numeric(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")),   h = 0.999,   Obs = MSEtool::Imprecise_Unbiased,   Imp = MSEtool::Perfect_Imp,   naa,   faa,   waa,   Mataa,   Maa,   laa,   nyr_par_mu = 3,   LowerTri = 1,   recind = 0,   plusgroup = TRUE,   altinit = 0,   fixq1 = TRUE,   report = FALSE,   silent = FALSE,   ... )

title: Reads bootstrap estimates from a stock assessment model (including VPA) into an operating model. Assess2OM is identical to VPA2OM. — Assess2OM
text: Name Character string. name operating model. proyears Positive integer. number projection years MSE. interval Positive integer. interval management procedures update management advice runMSE, e.g., 1 = annual updates. CurrentYr Positive integer. current year (final year fitting data) h steepness stock-recruitment curve (greater 0.2 less 1, assumed close 1 match VPA assumption). Either single numeric length nsim vector. Obs observation model (class Obs). function updates catch index observation error. Imp implementation model (class Imp). function update implementation parameters. naa Numeric array [sim, ages, year]. Numbers--age [first age age zero]. faa Numeric array [sim, ages, year]. Fishing mortality rate--age [first age age zero]. waa Numeric array [sim, ages, year]. Weight--age [first age age zero]. Mataa Numeric array [sim, ages, year]. Maturity (spawning fraction)--age [first age age zero]. Maa Numeric array [sim, ages, year]. Natural mortality rate--age [first age age zero]. laa Numeric array [sim, ages, year]. Length--age [first age age zero]. nyr_par_mu Positive integer. number recent years natural mortality, age vulnerability, weight, length maturity parameters averaged defining future projection conditions. LowerTri Integer. number recent years model estimates recruitment ignored (reliably estimated assessment) recind Positive integer. first age class fish 'recruit fishery'. default 0 - ie first position age dimension naa age zero plusgroup Logical. assessment assume oldest age class plusgroup? altinit Integer. Various assumptions set initial numbers. 0: standard, 1: plus group, 2: temporary fix MSEtool plus group initialization fixq1 Logical. q fixed (ie assume F--age array faa accurate? report Logical, TRUE, diagnostic reported showing matching OM reconstructed numbers age vs assessment. silent Whether silence messages console. ... Additional arguments (, either numeric length nsim vector): fecaa Fecundity age. Default fecundity product maturity weight age. SRrel Stock-recruit relationship. (1 Beverton-Holt (default), 2 Ricker) R0 unfished recruitment phi0 unfished spawners per recruit associated R0 h. time-varying parameters, openMSE uses mean phi0 first ageM (age 50 percent maturity) years stock-recruit relationship. Assess2OM re-calculate R0 h operating model stock-recruit alpha beta parameters match values implied input. Perr recruitment standard deviation (lognormal distribution) sampling future recruitment AC autocorrelation future recruitment deviates. spawn_time_frac fraction year spawning takes place (e.g., 0.5 midpoint year)

title: Reference management procedures — FMSYref
text: Several reference MPs operating model use management strategy evaluation. FMSYref (related) assume perfect information FMSY (FMSY taken operating model stored Data@Misc$ReferencePoints$ByYear$FMSY), set effort limit (TAE) F=FMSY (fraction FMSY) year MP applied. NFref sets annual catch zero used looking variability stock fishing.

title: Class 'Fleet' — Fleet-class
text: Name Identifying name fleet. Usually includes location gear type. nyears number years historical simulation. Single value. example, simulated population assumed unfished 1975 year want start historical simulations, recent year data available 2019, nyears equals 45. CurrentYr last historical year simulated projections begin. Single value. Note match last historical year specified Data object, usually last historical year data available. EffYears Vector indicating historical years information available infer relative fishing effort expended.vector specified terms position year vector rather calendar year. example, say simulation starts unfished stock 1975,current year (last year data available) 2019. 45 historical years simulated, EffYears include numbers 1 45. Note may information available every historical year, especially data poor fisheries. situations, EffYears vector include positions years information, vector may shorter total number simulated historical years (nyears). EffLower Lower bound relative fishing effort corresponding EffYears. EffLower must vector length EffYears describing fishing effort changed time. Information relative fishing effort can entered units provided consistent across entire vector data provided scaled 1 (divided maximum number provided). EffUpper Upper bound relative fishing effort corresponding EffYears. EffUpper must vector length EffYears describing fishing effort changed time. Information relative fishing effort can entered units provided consistent across entire vector data provided scaled 1 (divided maximum number provided). Esd Additional inter-annual variability fishing mortality rate. historical simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. parameter positive (non-zero) value, yearly fishing mortality rate drawn log-normal distribution standard deviation (log space) specified value Esd drawn simulation. parameter applies historical projections. qinc Mean temporal trend catchability (also though efficiency fishing gear) parameter, expressed percentage change catchability (q) per year. simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. Positive numbers indicate increase negative numbers indicate decrease. q changes amount year simulation parameter applies forward projections. qcv Inter-annual variability catchability expressed coefficient variation. simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. parameter applies forward projections. L5 Shortest length 5% population vulnerable selection gear used fleet. Values can either specified lengths (units used maturity growth parameters stock object) percentage size maturity (see parameter isRel information). simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. value years unless cpars used provide time-varying selection. LFS Shortest length 100% population vulnerable selection gear used fleet. Values can either specified lengths (units used maturity growth parameters stock object) percentage size maturity (see parameter isRel information). simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. value years unless cpars used provide time-varying selection. Vmaxlen Proportion fish selected gear asymptotic length (Stock@Linf). Upper Lower bounds 0 1.  value 1 indicates 100% fish selected asymptotic length, selection curve logistic. Vmaxlen less 1 selection curve dome shaped. example, Vmaxlen 0.4, 40% fish vulnerable fishing gear asymptotic length. isRel Specify whether selection retention parameters use absolute lengths relative size maturity. Single logical value (TRUE FALSE). LR5 Shortest length 5% population vulnerable retention fleet. Values can either specified lengths (units used maturity growth parameters stock object) percentage size maturity (see parameter isRel information). simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. value years unless cpars used provide time-varying selection. LFR Shortest length 100% population vulnerable retention fleet. Values can either specified lengths (units used maturity growth parameters stock object) percentage size maturity (see parameter isRel information). simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. value years unless cpars used provide time-varying selection. Rmaxlen Proportion fish retained asymptotic length (Stock@Linf). Upper Lower bounds 0 1.  value 1 indicates 100% fish retained asymptotic length, selection curve logistic. Rmaxlen less 1 retention curve dome shaped. example, Rmaxlen 0.4, 40% fish asymptotic length retained. DR Discard rate, defined proportion fully selected fish discarded fleet. Upper Lower bounds 0 1, value 1 indicates 100% selected fish discarded. simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. Spat_targ Distribution fishing relation vulnerable biomass (VB) across areas. distribution fishing effort proportional VB^Spat_targ. Upper lower bounds uniform distribution. simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. parameter allows user model either avoidance spatial targeting behavior fleet. parameter value 1, fishing effort allocated across areas proportion population density area. Values 1 simulate avoidance behavior values 1 simulate targeting behavior. MPA Logical argument (TRUE FALSE). Creates MPA Area 1 years true selected. Defaults FALSE. Misc Miscellaneous list bio-economic parameters

title: Lag the time-series slots in a Data object by a specified number of time-steps — Lag_Data
text: default, simulated data forward projections provided previous time-step. , projection year t, simulated data including t-1. function lag time-series values specified value. example, Data_Lag=5 mean projection time-step t data including t-6. Note: Data@Year slot lagged function. Many built-MPs use length Data@Year determine number years data smoothing recent years etc. may appropriate check MP behaving expect use Lag_Data.

title: Lag the time-series slots in a Data object by a specified number of time-steps — Lag_Data
code: # Lag all time-series slots by 2 time-steps (usually years) Data <- Example_datafile Lagged_1 <- Lag_Data(Data, 2) length(Data@Year) #> [1] 13 length(Lagged_1@Year) #> [1] 13 length(Data@Cat[1,]) #> [1] 13 length(Lagged_1@Cat[1,]) #> [1] 11 length(Data@Ind[1,]) #> [1] 13 length(Lagged_1@Ind[1,]) #> [1] 11  # Lag CAA by 5 and Ind by 3 time-steps Lagged_2 <- Lag_Data(Data, Data_Lag=list(CAA=5, Ind=3)) length(Lagged_2@Year) #> [1] 13 length(Lagged_2@Cat[1,]) #> [1] 13 dim(Data@CAA[1,,]) #> [1] 13 16 dim(Lagged_2@CAA[1,,]) #> [1]  8 16  length(Data@Ind[1,]) #> [1] 13 length(Lagged_2@Ind[1,]) #> [1] 10

Single value nsim number simulations proyears number projected years interval assessment interval - often like update management system? pstar percentile sample management recommendation method maxF Maximum instantaneous fishing mortality rate may simulated given age class reps Number samples management recommendation method. Note set 1, mean value data inputs used. cpars hierarchical list nstock nfleet long custom parameters. Time series matrix nsim rows nyears columns. Single parameters vector nsim long seed random seed ensure users can reproduce results exactly Source reference website article parameters taken define operating model Stocks List stock objects Fleets List Fleet objects Obs Hierarchical List Observation model objects Level 1 stock, level 2 fleet Imps Hierarchical List Implementation model objects Level 1 stock, level 2 fleet CatchFrac list nstock long, matrices nsim x nfleet representing fraction current catches various fleets stock (matrix nsim nfleet long rows sum 1 stock) Allocation list nstock long, matrices nsim x nfleet representing fraction future TACs various fleets stock (matrix nsim nfleet long rows sum 1 stock). Efactor list nstock long, current effort factors fleet (default 1 - current effort) Complexes list stock complexes. position vector stock numbers (appear StockPars) data aggregated TAC recommendations split among stocks according vulnerable biomass SexPars list slots control sex-specific dynamics, .e., sex-specific spawning hermaphroditism. generally, controls spawning moving abundance stocks. title: Class 'Obs' — Obs-class
text: Name name observation model object. Single value. Character string. Name name Observation error object. Single value. Character string. Cobs Observation error around total catch. Observation error total catch expressed coefficient variation (CV). Cobs requires upper lower bounds uniform distribution, simulation CV sampled distribution. CV used specify log-normal error distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. yearly observation error values catch data drawn distribution. time step simulation model records true catch, observed catch generated applying yearly error term (plus bias, specified) true catch. Cbiascv Log-normally distributed coefficient variation controlling sampling bias observed catch simulation. Bias occurs catches systematically skewed away true catch level (example, due underreporting catch undetected illegal catches). Cbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. CAA_nsamp Number catch--age observations collected per time step. time step single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. Positive integers. CAA_ESS Effective sample size catch--age observations collected per time step. time step single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. CAA_ESS exceed CAA_nsamp. greater 1, multinomial distribution sample size. less 1, coefficient variation logistic normal distribution (see help doucmentation simCAA details). CAL_nsamp Number catch--length observations collected per time step. time step single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. Positive integers. CAL_ESS Effective sample size. time step single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. CAL_ESS exceed CAL_nsamp. Positive integers. Iobs Observation error relative abundance index expressed coefficient variation (CV). Iobs requires upper lower bounds uniform distribution, simulation CV sampled distribution. CV used specify log-normal error distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. yearly observation error values index abundance data drawn distribution. time step simulation model records true change abundance, observed index generated applying yearly error term (plus bias, specified) true relative change abundance. Positive real numbers. Btobs Observation error absolute abundance expressed coefficient variation (CV). Btobs requires upper lower bounds uniform distribution, simulation CV sampled distribution. CV used specify log-normal error distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. yearly observation error values absolute abundance data drawn distribution. time step simulation model records true abundance, observed abundance generated applying yearly error term (plus bias, specified) true abundance. Positive real numbers. Btbiascv Log-normally distributed coefficient (CV) controlling error observations current stock biomass. Bias occurs observed index abundance systematically higher lower true relative abundance. Btbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. beta parameter controlling hyperstability/hyperdepletion measurement abundance. simulation single value drawn uniform distribution specified upper lower bounds provided. Values 1 lead hyperstability (observed index decreases slowly true abundance) values 1 lead hyperdepletion (observed index decreases rapidly true abundance).  Positive real numbers. LenMbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed length 50 percent maturity. LenMbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Mbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed natural mortality rate. Mbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Kbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed growth parameter K. Kbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. t0biascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed t0. t0biascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Linfbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed maximum length. Linfbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. LFCbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed length first capture. LFCbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. LFSbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias length--full selection. LFSbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. FMSY_Mbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias estimates ratio fishing mortality rate gives maximum sustainable yield relative assumed instantaneous natural mortality rate. FMSY/M. FMSY_Mbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. BMSY_B0biascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias estimates BMSY relative unfished biomass (BMSY/B0). BMSY_B0biascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Irefbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed relative index abundance (Iref). Irefbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Brefbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed reference biomass (Bref). Brefbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Crefbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed reference catch (Cref). Crefbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Dbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling bias observed depletion level.  Dbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Dobs Log-normal coefficient variation controlling error observations stock depletion among years. Observation error depletion expressed coefficient variation (CV). Dobs requires upper lower bounds uniform distribution, simulation CV sampled distribution. CV used specify log-normal error distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. yearly observation error values depletion data drawn distribution. time step simulation model records true depletion, observed depletion generated applying yearly error term (plus bias, specified) true depletion. hbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling persistent bias steepness. hbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Recbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling persistent bias recent recruitment strength. Recbiascv requires upper lower bounds uniform distribution, simulation CV sampled distribution. CV used specify log-normal error distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. yearly bias values depletion data drawn distribution. Positive real numbers. sigmaRbiascv Log-normal coefficient variation sampling persistent bias recruitment variability. sigmaRbiascv single value specifying standard deviation log-normal distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. simulation bias value drawn distribution, bias applied across years. Positive real numbers. Eobs Observation error around total effort. Observation error total effort expressed coefficient variation (CV). Eobs requires upper lower bounds uniform distribution, simulation CV sampled distribution. CV used specify log-normal error distribution mean 1 standard deviation equal sampled CV. yearly observation error values effort data drawn distribution. time step simulation model records true effort, observed effort generated applying yearly error term (plus bias, specified) true effort. Ebiascv Log-normally distributed coefficient variation controlling sampling bias observed effort simulation. Bias occurs effort systematically skewed away true effort level. AAVY maximum acceptable variability yield (.e, default AAVY Ref=0.2) Yrs argument defines number years calculate performance statistic . value NULL, default AAVY, AAVE, P10, P50, P100, PNOF, means performance metric calculated projection years. numeric vector length two used specify first last year, e.g, Yrs=c(1,10) performance statistic calculated first 10 projection years. numeric vector length one positive negative value respectively can used specify first x last x years, e.g, Yrs=10 first 10 years, Yrs=-10 last 10 years. See ChkYrs details. default Long-Term Yield (LTY) Yield last ten years projection period MSE, Short-Term Yield (STY) first 10 years projection period.

WLa positive real number array [sim, ages, year]. default weight-length parameter (W=aL^b) WLb positive real number array [sim, ages, year]. default weight-length parameter b (W=aL^b) WAAind positive integer. index WHAM weight--age array input$data$waa assumed weight--age operating model Obs observation model (class Obs). function updates catch index observation error. LowerTri Integer. number recent years model estimates recruitment ignored (reliably estimated assessment) plusgroup Logical. assessment assume oldest age class plusgroup? altinit Integer. code: Prob_staying<-0.8 # probability  that individuals remain in area 1 between time-steps Frac_area_1<-0.35 # the fraction of the stock found in area 1 under equilibrium conditions markovmat<-getmov2(1,Prob_staying, Frac_area_1) vec<-c(0.5,0.5) # initial guess at equilibrium distribution (2 areas) for(i in 1:300)vec<-apply(vec*markovmat,2,sum) # numerical approximation to stable distribution c(markovmat[1,1],vec[1]) # pretty close right? #> [1] 0.7999999 0.3500000

title: MICE relationships for multi-OM — makeRel
text: class "Rel" object pass MOM@Rel.

title: MICE relationships for multi-OM — makeRel
text: Natural mortality (M) linear function stock depletion terms total biomass (B) year y (Forrest et al. 2018): $$M_y = M_0 + (M_1 + M_0) (1 - B_y/B_0)$$ constraint \(M_y = M_0\) \(B_y > B_0\) Provide following arguments: M0: Natural mortality B approaches B0. Vector [nsim] M1: Natural mortality B approaches zero. Vector [nsim] Optional B0: Unfished biomass. Calculated stock-recruit alpha beta unfished biomass per recruit M = M0. Vector [nsim]

title: MICE relationships for multi-OM — makeRel
text: Forrest, R., Holt, K., Kronlund, . 2018. Performance alternative harvest control rules two Pacific groundfish stocks uncertain natural mortality: Bias, robustness trade-offs. Fisheries Research 206: 259–286. doi:10.1016/j.fishres.2018.04.007

title: MICE relationships for multi-OM — makeRel
text: Q. Huynh

title: MICE relationships for multi-OM — makeRel
code: # Depensatory natural mortality Rel <- makeRel(type = "DDM", M0 = 0.8, M1 = 0.2, CV = 0.1)  # Predict M when B/B0 = 0.1 pred <- predict(Rel, newdata = data.frame(B_1 = 0.1, B0_1 = 1))  # Simulate values of M with CV = 0.1 Rel$fitted.values <- pred simulate(Rel, nsim = 10, seed = 1) #>       sim_1     sim_2     sim_3    sim_4     sim_5     sim_6     sim_7 #> 1 0.2430378 0.2634926 0.2380192 0.303335 0.2673545 0.2383794 0.2715994 #>       sim_8     sim_9    sim_10 #> 1 0.2784825 0.2740037 0.2509475  # Add Rel to MOM MOM <- makeMOM(testOM) MOM@Rel <- list(Rel)

COSEWIC_Pplot(   MSEobj,   syear = 2017,   qcol = "#FFCB62",   quants = c(0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95) )  COSEWIC_Dplot(   MSEobj,   syear = 2017,   qcol = "#79F48D",   quants = c(0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95),   nGT = 3 )  COSEWIC_Blow(   MSEobj,   syear = 2017,   qcol = rgb(0.4, 0.8, 0.95),   quants = c(0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95),   nGT = 3 )  COSEWIC_Hplot(   MSEobj,   syear = 2017,   qcol = rgb(0.4, 0.8, 0.95),   quants = c(0.05, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 0.95) )  COSEWIC_report(   MSEobj,   output_file = NA,   author = "Author not specified",   title = NA )  COSEWIC_tab(MSEobj, rnd = 0, GTs = c(3, 6), syear = 2017, nGT = 3)  COSEWIC_tab_formatted(   Ptab1,   thresh = c(20, 40, 40, 20, 40, 40, 40, 30, 5),   ret_thresh = F )

GTs vector mean generation times evaluate performance metrics Ptab1 COSEWIC performance table made COSEWIC_tab thresh vector thresholds column Health, Yield Reb 'greater threshold' conditions ret_thresh Logical: true just threshold levels returned

title: COSEWIC MSE run using the correct MPs and projected time horizon — runCOSEWIC
text: runCOSEWIC(): Calls runMSE number projection years 6x maximum age uses NFref, FMSYref, curE MPs. COSEWIC_Pplot(): Projection plots spawning stock biomass three scenarios: catch, FMSY fishing status quo fishing effort. COSEWIC_Dplot(): Depletion plots evaluate whether significant declines occurred three generation times historical projection years. COSEWIC_Blow(): Plots evaluate likelihood declining Blow, default, biomass takes 3 generation times reach half BMSY zero fishing COSEWIC_Hplot(): Plots historical spawning stock  relative unfished MSY levels. COSEWIC_report(): Create standard DFO COSEWIC report (provides performance plots inform COSEWIC processes Canadian fish stocks). COSEWIC_tab(): Creates standard COSEWIC performance table: P_Cr probability critical zone (less 20% depletion) P_Ct probability cautious zone (20% 40% depletion) P_H probability healthy zone (40% depletion) P_Cr_MSY probability critical zone (less 40% BMSY) P_Ct_MSY probability cautious zone (40% 80% BMSY) P_H_MSY probability healthy zone (80% BMSY) Caut probability cautious zone last 10 projected years P_A1 probability designated threatened according COSEWIC Indicator A1 (Spawning biomass less 70% three generation times previously) P_A2 probability designated threatened according COSEWIC Indicator A2 (Spawning biomass less 50% three generation times previously) Blow probability stock biomass takes 3 generation times reach 50% BMSY zero fishing COSEWIC_tab_formatted(): formatted version standard COSEWIC performance plot, color coded thresholds.

title: Run a Management Strategy Evaluation — Simulate
text: MPs, running parallel can actually lead increase computation time, due overhead sending information cores. Consequently, default MPs run parallel parallel=TRUE (although internal code run parallel mode). run MPs parallel, specify named list name MP(s) assigned TRUE. example,parallel=list(AvC=TRUE) run AvC MP parallel mode.

title: Run a Management Strategy Evaluation — Simulate
text: Additional savings computation time can achieved running entire simulation batches. Individual simulations operating model divided separate cores using SubCpars, Simulate Project applied independently core via snowfall::sfClusterApplyLB, output (list MSE objects) stitched back together single MSE object using joinMSE. ideal number cores determined based number simulations available cores. several issues look using split-apply-combine technique: Numerical optimization depletion may fail individual cores OM@cpars$qs specified. Length bins specified operating model OM@cpars$CAL_bins. Otherwise, length bins can vary core create problems combining single object. Compared non-parallel runs, sampled parameters operating model vary despite value OM@seed. error individual cores combining parallel output single Hist MSE object, list output (cores) returned.

title: MSEtool 3.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-09 new major release MSEtool package. backwards compatible previous versions MSEtool DLMtool.

title: MSEtool 3.0.0
text: significant change version MSEtool package now contains code related generating operating models, simulating fisheries dynamics, conducting management strategy evaluation, examining results (previously DLMtool package). change primarily done better align actual contents packages respective package names. MSEtool now set reference management procedures (e.g., FMSYref) Data-Limited Methods Toolkit package now contains collection data-limited methods, uses MSEtool V3+ dependency; .e., installing loading DLMtool also install load MSEtool make functions generating OMs, conducting MSE, etc available. operating model updated age-0 age-class added population dynamics model; .e., recruitment now age-0 (previously OM DLMtool recruitment age-1). catch--age (CAA) Data object now includes age-0 (.e., age data must length maxage+1)
